headline: VIDEO: Laura Ingraham Goes Against Trump And Hannity, Calls Their Latest Move A ‘Mistake’
author: DML News App
sentences:
Conway dodge the question, saying, “I think that it confused many Republicans and conservatives in Pennsylvania because they’ve seen Oz at his own words on video about [being] against guns, for abortion, praising Hillary Clinton as one of the most brilliant women, smartest women he’s ever met, being for Obamacare and so on and so forth.”
WATCH the full exchange below, as Ingraham pushes back, saying it was a mistake for Trump to endorse Oz.

Trump endorsed Oz’s candidacy Saturday, saying Oz will be “most able” to defeat a “radical Left Democrat looking to do unthinkable harm” to the U.S. Ingraham played footage of Oz discussing red flag laws and claiming a fetal heart is not beating at six weeks gestation, then asked former Trump-era senior counsel Kellyanne Conway if the endorsement was a mistake.

‘What the hell was he thinking?’: Pennsylvania conservatives react to Trump’s support of Oz https://t.co/25Do3BHEot
— Laura Ingraham (@IngrahamAngle) April 11, 2022
Laura Ingraham Calls Trump And Hannity’s Endorsement Of Dr. Oz A ‘Mistake’ https://t.co/qTB0L9xk8Y
— Daily Caller (@DailyCaller) April 13, 2022

Fox News host Laura Ingraham called former President Donald Trump and her colleague Sean Hannity’s endorsement of Republican Pennsylvania Senate candidate Dr. Mehmet Oz a “mistake” Tuesday.

The article goes on to state the following:
“Was it a mistake, Kellyanne?” Ingraham asked.
